item.title: The Code Book - Review
item.description: Rating: 5 / 5 I was interested in Cryptography and Number Theory during my undergraduate studies so reading the history of Cryptography in this book was intriguing for me. The author has done excellent work in making sure that even an uninitiated person in Cryptography can understand and appreciate the importance of work done in this field.

item.title: 7 Secrets of Vishnu - Review
item.description: Rating: 4.5 / 5 For me, reading this book was to look at the things that I already knew, from a different perspective â€” not necessarily the view that I agree with. This book starts with Mohini and goes on to tell the stories of all the mainstream avatars of Vishnu and what the significance of those avatars was, in their respective time periods.

item.title: Introducing Quantum Theory - Review
item.description: Rating: 4.2 / 5 There was a time when I used to despise Physics. I still do not know the exact reason behind this feeling because I was much interest in Physics in general. Perhaps the mathematical questions of JEE put me off.

item.title: The Rozabal Line - Review
item.description: Rating: 3.8 / 5 It was an exciting read for me. I must say the amount of research done by the author is really commendable. Given the topic of this work, the author comes very close to getting everything right, but eventually, he misses the mark.
